page.title: 06ECOLOGY OF THE LEVEN VALLEY
page.content: IN THE SURROUNDING AREA OF THE RIVER LEVEN THERE EXISTS A LARGE VARIETY OF WILDLIFE.AT ARNOT TOWER IN THE MIXED WOODLAND THERE ARE OVER 100 ROOKS NESTS INDICATING THERE ARE OVER 250 ROOKS.NESTING BEGINS LOCALLY BY THE 1st OF MARCH.PHEASANTS ABOUND.THE NEST IS MADE BY THE FEMALE PHEASANT.IT IS A HOLLOW IN THE GROUND FREQUENTLY UNDER THICK VEGETATION.THE NEST IS LINED SCANTILY WITH FOLIAGE.THE 8-15 PALE OLIVE EGGS ARE LAID IN APRIL TO JUNE.THE ADULT PHEASANTS FEED ON A VARIETY OF ANIMALS AND VEGETATION. CHUKAIR OR ROCK PARTRIDGE ARE LAID DOWN FOR SHOOTING AT GREENHEAD OF ARNOT. GREYLAG,PINKFEET GEESE AND SOMETIMES IN WINTER WHOOPER SWANS GRAZE ON THE FORMER FLOOD PLAIN OF THE RIVER LEVEN BUT THEY ROOST OUTWITH THE AREA ON LOCH LEVEN OR ON BALLO RESERVOIR.
